title: Oregon State to co-lead $30 million USDA regional food business center - Oregon State University
summary: Oregon State University and Colorado State University are leading a new USDA-funded regional food business center. The center will support farmers and food businesses in the Northwest and Rocky Mountain region, focusing on areas such as strengthening local supply chains, connecting food entrepreneurs, and supporting climate-resilient agriculture.  The center aims to address challenges faced by small and mid-sized agricultural businesses and foster the development of sustainable food systems in the region.

title: UM Announces New U.S. Leadership Across Growth, Strategy, Planning, Intelligence, Client Services and Operations - PR Newswire
summary: UM, a global media agency network, announced new leadership appointments in the US, including a Chief Growth Officer, Chief Strategy Officer, Chief Planning Officer, Chief Intelligence Officer, Chief Client Officer and Chief Operating Officer. These appointments aim to strengthen UM's capabilities and offerings in the marketplace, particularly in areas like business development, strategy, planning, intelligence, client relations and operations. title: The challenges of greenhouse gas accounting in the UK's waste and recycling sector - Ricardo PLC
summary: The UK waste and recycling sector is facing challenges in accurately measuring and reporting its greenhouse gas emissions, particularly in accounting for avoided emissions. Ricardo, a consulting firm specializing in waste management, highlights the need for a framework to assess avoided emissions and provides solutions for data collection and reporting. The article emphasizes the importance of accurate carbon accounting for the sector's journey to net zero by 2040.

title: Tesla Teases Two New EVs That Could Sell More Than 5 Million Units Per Year - CarScoops
summary: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, announced two new electric vehicles (EVs) at the company's annual shareholder meeting. He claimed that the design and manufacturing of these EVs are superior to anything else in the industry and predicted that combined sales could exceed 5 million units per year. While specifics remain unclear, the teaser image suggests the EVs may be updated versions of existing models, such as the Model 3 and Model Y, with improved technology and efficiency.
